Why can't I move stuff around?

While we realize customization is a compelling feature of a portal, since MyCPP is a new service, we want to launch with a consistent experience for users so we can learn some lessons from the users. In the future we expect to open up MyCPP to user customizations.

Why is the information in Notifications different than what I see in the BroncoDirect Student Center?

Currently the information displayed in MyCPP from the BroncoDirect Student Center is as of the previous day. An update in the near future will display current information from BroncoDirect.

I checked my Notifications, why is there still a number at the top of the screen?

MyCPP is designed to display information that is of interest to you, but it does not record that you have looked at the information. While the Notification indicator is similar to what may be displayed on a smart device, the behavior is different. It shows the number of items displayed, regardless of whether you have looked at them or not. This feature is under evaluation for a future update to make it behave similar to notification indicators on smart devices.

Is there a mobile app for MyCPP?

Like the Cal Poly Pomona website, MyCPP is designed to display correctly on a variety of devices including desktops, tablets, and smart phones. Because of that, currently there are no plans to make MyCPP an "app". However, for direct access to MyCPP on a smart device you can add an icon to your home screen. Additonally a future update to the CPP Mobile app will include a direct link to MyCPP.

MyCPP looks OK on my device, but why don't all the other online services?

The other online services that MyCPP provides access to may or may not render correctly on various devices depending on the service and the vendor. Cal Poly Pomona actively chooses services that display well on a variety of devices, however some providers of existing services are slower than others in making their offering "mobile friendly".

Why do links open in a new tab?

MyCPP allows acces to a variety of other services with a single login. Unless you sign out of MyCPP, that single login is active as long as your browser is open, even after you navigate away from MyCPP. If links to other online services opened in the same window, users may forget to return to MyCPP to sign out. By opening links in a new tab, users still see the MyCPP tab, and hopefully return to sign out when they are done.

I accessed another service from MyCPP. I logged out of that service so why was I still logged in when I went back?

If you haven't signed out of MyCPP and you haven't closed your browser, you still have a log in session that will prevent you from being asked for your credentials on most of the online services that work with the single login. To be sure your single login session is closed, always sign out of MyCPP and close your browser.
